Configuration.StudyNameEntrez: Pooled Genome-Wide Analysis of Kidney Cancer Risk (KIDRISK)
Configuration.StudyNameReportPage: Pooled Genome-Wide Analysis of Kidney Cancer Risk (KIDRISK)
Configuration.Description: Incidence rates of renal cell carcinoma (RCC) are rising and the latest estimates show that it accounts for over 300,000 cases and 120,000 deaths worldwide each year. Mechanisms underlying RCC occurrence are not fully understood and a large part of the disease heritability remains unexplained. The study aimed at augmenting the size of available RCC genome-wide association studies to increase the statistical power to detect genetic variants associated with the disease. The study includes genome-wide genotyping data from RCC cases (n=2,781) and controls (n=2,526) recruited in Western Europe, Central and Eastern Europe, and Australia.
Configuration.StudyInEx:
Cases with ICD code C64.9
Controls were cancer free subjects
Unrelated subjects with more than 70% Caucasian ancestry were kept in final dataset.

Configuration.StudyHistory: The genotyping was centrally performed at the Centre National de Genotypage (Evry, France) from April 2013 to July 2014.

ParticipantSet.UseLimitation: Use of this data is limited to health/medical/biomedical purposes, does not include the study of population origins or ancestry. Requestor agrees to make results of studies using the data available to the larger scientific community. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).

Use of the data must be related to Cancer. Use of the data is limited to not-for-profit organizations. Use of the data is limited to genetic studies only. Data is available for cancer research relating to population structure (including research that may have applications or implications for the understanding of ancestral history, because of the information it may provide about allele frequencies in different populations). Data is NOT available for genetic research on non-cancer and/or non-disease traits (e.g., intelligence, behavioral traits). Data is NOT available for general methods development research,
Use of the data must be related to Kidney Cancer. Use of the data includes methods development research (e.g., development of software or algorithms).
